intro: Strobilanthes pluriformis, commonly known as the "Cape York beauty," is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland and swampy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers, which come in shades of red, pink, and white, bloom in late winter to early spring. Strobilanthes pluriformis is also noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
